intro: Hemionitis parvula, commonly known as the small hemionitis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It has a compact, mat-forming growth habit with rosettes of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is adapted to thrive in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert environments. Hemionitis parvula is a member of the family Polypodiaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial ferns.
